abstract: New York State Education Dept documents reveal that over 200 teachers and principals in state received faulty growth scores, which tie their performances to how well their students do on state exams; revelation may be yet another blow to effort to link educator performance with student performance on exams, which has been contentious policy.
lead_paragraph: The error could be another blow to the practice of linking teacher performance to student exams, a system that has come under fire in recent years.

headline.main: Over 200 Educators in New York Receive Erroneous Scores Linked to Student Performance
headline.print_headline: Over 200 Educators Receive Erroneous Scores Linked to Student Performance

snippet: The error could be another blow to the practice of linking teacher performance to student exams, a system that has come under fire in recent years.
